query: I receive Attendance Allowance but my care needs have increased in leeds. Can the council provide additional financial support?

Council Tax –  Application for Carer Discount  
 If a person is a carer, we  may be able to award a Council  Tax discount .  The conditions are:  
 
• the carer lives with and cares for someone for at least 35 hours per week  
 
• the person being cared for is not the carer’s spouse or partner or child under 18  
 
• one of the benefits listed over the page is being paid and you send us proof of this  
 
Whether or not we can award this discount is affected by the number of adults who live at the 
property, we will assess this as part of the application.  
 If you think you meet the above conditions, please fill in the application form on the back of this 
letter and send it back to us. Please make sure you send us proof of the benefit which is being 
paid or we will have to reject the application.

answer:
If your care needs have increased in Leeds, you may be eligible for additional support from the council. While Attendance Allowance is a benefit that helps with personal care costs, Leeds City Council can provide additional social care support, which may include financial assistance depending on your circumstances.

- **Social Care Support**: You can receive a paid carer as part of a support plan from the council. This is not free, but you may qualify for help to pay for some or all of it. You should contact Leeds City Council to discuss your needs and arrange an assessment for social care support. More information can be found on their website: [Leeds Adult Social Care](https://www.leeds.gov.uk/adult-social-care/help-at-home/care-in-your-home).

- **Direct Payments**: If you prefer to arrange your own care, you might be eligible for direct payments, which allow you to hire a personal assistant or care agency directly. The Leeds Direct Payment and PA Support Hub can provide assistance with this process. Contact them via email at LeedsDPandPAsupporthub@leeds.gov.uk or by phone at 0113 378 3936.

- **Additional Financial Support**: If your financial situation is affected by your increased care needs, you can explore other benefits or financial support options, such as Carer’s Allowance or Council Tax Support. For urgent financial help, you can contact the local welfare support team at 0113 868 9808.

For more detailed advice and to explore all available options, consider reaching out to the Leeds City Council contact centre at 0113 222 4401. They can guide you through the process and help determine what support you may be eligible for.
